columns.text: In this problem, we will solve for the internal rate of return of a project based on the given factors.

To solve for the cash flow, we must first solve for the straigh-line depreciation. This can be done by taking the initial value of the asset and dividing it by the number of years.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Depreciation}&=\dfrac{\$485,000}{5}\\[15 pt]
&=\$97,000
\end{aligned}$$

The asset loses $\$97,000$ annually.

We will then take the depreciation and subtract it from the initial savings to get the earnings before interest and tax (EBIT).

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{EBIT}&=\$140,000-\$97,000\\[15 pt]
&=\$43,000
\end{aligned}$$

The earnings before interest and tax for this project is $\$43,000$

To get the tax, multiply the earnings before interest to the tax rate of $24\%$

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Tax}&=\$43,000 \times 0.24\\[15 pt]
&=\$10,320
\end{aligned}$$

The tax for this project is $\$10,320$

Now that we have the necessary information, we can now solve for the operating cash flow of the project. For this, we will take the earnings before interest and tax, subtract the tax, then add the depreciation.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Operating cash flow}&=\$43,000-\$10,320+\$97,000\\[15 pt]
&=\$129,680
\end{aligned}$$

The operating cash flow of this project is $\$129,680$

Again, we will use the concept of present value annuity for the cash flow. The present value annuity factor is the value multiplied to the operating cash flow to determine its future value at the end of the project. Using the annuity table, the factor we will use is $2.75$.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Present value of operating cash flow}&=\$129,680 \times 2.75\\[15 pt]
&=\$356,620
\end{aligned}$$

At the end of the period, the operating cash flow will be valued at $\$356,620$

Another thing that we need to solve is the after-tax salvage value. This is the salvage value multiplied to $1$ minus the tax rate.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{After-tax salvage value}&=\$35,000\times(1-0.24)\\[15 pt]
&=\$26,600
\end{aligned}$$

After tax, the salvage value will be $\$26,600$.

Using the given values, we can use the formula in Step 2 to solve for the internal rate of return. Take note that in order to solve this, we must set the nt present value as $0$.

$$\begin{aligned}
0&=-\$485,000+\$140,000+\\
&\left(\$356,620+\left(\dfrac{\$26,600-\$60,000}{(1+\text{IRR})^5}\right)\right)
\end{aligned}$$

Cross multiply and we will get:

$$\begin{aligned}
(1+\text{IRR})^5&=2.8744
\end{aligned}$$

Take the $5$th root of both sides then subtract one from each side to get the final answer

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{IRR}&=0.235
\end{aligned}$$

The internal rate of return for this project is $0.235$ or $23.5\%$
